data.title: Awesome
data.text: Food is amazing!  The service is great and it is very well decorated and quite cozy. I would recommend to everyone.

data.title: Great meal
data.text: Located close to hotel, food was great and had GF options that were very tasty. Waitress was very knowledgeable about the way food was prepared making the  choices easy.

data.title: Not as good as the one near Golden, Colorado
data.text: It was average in experience and food quality. The original Purple Ginger on Youngfield street near Golden is much better.

data.title: Fast and delicious
data.text: We got delivery to our hotel next door and it was great! Wonton soup was great! We ordered online and it was very fast and easy to use.

data.title: Never Busy; VERY fresh asian
data.text: This restaurant is slightly off the beaten path, surrounded by hotels.  I am sure it is that clientele that keeps the restaurant in operation, because it has never been crowded when we go.  All of the sauces are prepared along with the other ingredients. All the dished can be adjusted to taste; less spicy, different vegetables, etc.The quantity and quality is above average at a very reasonable price.  I would definitely eat here over Some of the large chain Asian restaurants.

data.title: Over-priced, poor quality
data.text: We wanted Asian food and now I understand why there are few customers.  Evidently, that is the norm.  We didn't have time to search, but I'm sure there are better Asians restaurants in the area.

data.title: Lovely decor.....average meal.
data.text: We were in the mood for Asian food while visiting the area.  We chose this place due to proximity to our hotel and ratings. When we walked in we were the only customers....not a good sign, but the weather wasn't great. The decor was really nice, and the restaurant is huge. Unfortunately the food was just ok. My husband had chicken satay for an appetizer, and said it was a little bland. I had panang curry and he had sesame chicken. We were not blown away. My panang was too sweet. Our server was pleasant and the price was good, but we probably would not return.

data.title: Pretty good Pan-Asian if you're staying close by
data.text:
I wouldn't drive out of my way for it, but enjoyed my meal. During happy hour, small plates are half price (nice selection too), & there are specials on well drinks, house wine & beer. I had dumplings & a sushi roll & both were nice. Nothing particularly authentic or amazing, but tasty treats.
Kind of a weird atmosphere. HUGE dining room, which was nearly empty (Tuesday night, but right at dinner time). I was seated in the furthest possible spot from the (completely enclosed) kitchen, yet heard lots of kitchen noise.

data.title: Great Food, Enviroment, and Reasonable Prices
data.text: My passenger and I were in the mood for Chinese and Japanase cuisine after driving my teenage son to the Denver Airport on Friday afternoon.  When we pulled into the parking lot, it wasn't busy and we were seated right away. Our server Mark was friendly, attentive, and made our experience that much nicer.  We had sushi, spicy udon noodles and 2 more dishes. All the cooked dishes were done so to perfection and the sauces were spot on. The sushi was wonderful as well. I would definitely go back and will tell my friends about this place too !

data.title: Reasonable prices, good food
data.text: The food here was really delicious, especially for the reasonable prices. Highly recommend the General Tao's Chicken and the Chicken Lettuce Wraps!

data.title: Great Asian Food
data.text: The facility was clean, the service great, and the food outstanding.  We were there for lunch and they easily satisfied my wife's need for gluten and dairy free entrees.  We weren't disappointed with the price as it was very reasonable.

data.title: Average Asian fare
data.text: We were staying next door so we tried this restaurant.  It was reasonably priced with many menu options.  The service was good and the food was average.

data.title: Worst food and service I have EVER experienced!!!!
data.text:
I should have known when we pulled into the parking lot at 6:30, there was only one car.  I ordered miso soup ( that never came) and garlic chicken.  What came was a fried plate of chicken with vegetables that were rolled in salt.  Inedible!  I ate one bite.  My spouse ordered the "lemon chicken" and it had about 1/4 thick syrup that over-powered whatever they were trying to serve here.
I was appalled that when the waitress asked if we wanted boxes and we explained neither meals were good, she said, "oh...sorry" and promptly brought our check...$25 for the two worst meals...EVER!!!!!
Avoid at all cost!!!!  I cannot believe this place is still in business!!!!!!!

data.title: Stay away from the Pad Thai
data.text:
Stopped in on a recent business trip.  Sunday night and the parking lot was nearly empty.  That should have been a clue.  I was the one of two patrons.  The place is about go undergo a renovation.  Carpets tattered.
I ordered some eggroll which were hot and tasty. Also ordered the Chicken Pad Thai.  It was try, sticky, few vegetables and little chicken.  Picked around, had a few bites and gave up.  The water wanted to know if I needed a box.  I told him it was the worst Pad Thai I had ever eaten.  He apologized and took it to the management.  They refused to make any kind of an adjustment to the bill.  Needless to say I left with a bad taste in my mouth.

data.title: Based on the atmosphere investment, the food should be good, but not quite.
data.text:
One of the tip-offs that something might not be quite right is when there are no customers in the restaurant. We found this to be the case on several occasions so I don't think it's an anomaly. There are hotels nearby as well as long-stay apartments nearby, but not very many customers.

We thought, the better for us. They would probably rather be working than just hanging around but we found the food preparation time to be rather long considering there were only the four us in the restaurant and the food we ordered was not unusual.

The waiter was attentive and I asked him if it usually took so long to cook food for four people since if they had a full house folks would be waiting for hours to get their food based on what we were experiencing. He said that there had been some changes in the kitchen, but that our food would be right out. Fifteen minutes later it arrived. Some dishes were not quite cold, some were as hot as you would expect.

The biggest complaint was that the food was nicely presented, but it was bland as if no seasoning had been used to cook the food. All of us felt like we've had much better asian food at any number of places.

The location has good parking, nice interior, clean looking cooking area, the waiter was good, just that everything was so sloooooowww and had no seasoning to speak of. For the quality of the food (mostly the bland taste) it seemed expensive. If the food would've been cooked better and served hot, we could've overlooked the long wait time and the price would seem fair given the amount of food and the ambience.

data.title: Deeeeelicious!
data.text: The restaurant had a great atmosphere.  It was quiet for a Saturday night, which I didn't understand because the service and food were both spectacular.

data.title: Large, tasty portions; quick service
data.text: I placed a to-go order at one in the afternoon on a Tuesday. They were very attentive and placed my order immediately, it was only a 10 minute wait. The drunken noodles were awesome and fresh. The portions were large and I ended up only getting through half.

data.title: Good food.
data.text: I enjoyed the pork red curry and the veggie tempura. The chicken coconut soup was very good, too. Our server, Tasha, was lovely and helpful.

data.title: Adequate
data.text: My wife and I headed out for Chinese food on a cold night in the 30s because of the reviews for this restaurant. It was beautifully decorated. We ordered an appetizer of edamame, which was delicious. We also ordered a sizzling dish and a basket container of seamed vegetables. The sizzling dish had 3 kinds of meat, albeit in very small quantity, and a lot of vegetables. It was quite tasty. The vegetable container had a tasty sauce. Both dishes were adequate, nothing to rave about. The service was very good. The restaurant was quite empty because of the nearness of Thanksgiving.

data.title: Awesome little hideaway!
data.text: We wanted something different than the multiple chains that surround this area and it did not disappoint! Great service, food and drinks! Definitely recommend the Golden Goose to drink, Panang Curry and soft shell crab green island for the entree and satay and pot stickers for appetizers! We spent $100 on our meal the night before and paid half the price here and got twice the food!!! I would recommend this to anyone- best Thai and Chinese I've had in a long time!!!
